intro: Camptosema paraguariense var. parviflorum, commonly known as the Paraguayan camptosema, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It has hairy leaves and stems, which are typical of many species in its family. This variant is noted for its compact growth habit and is often found in moist, tropical environments.
